1124351990207799296.text: I've finally got round to writing my first blog post! It's aimed at anyone looking to get started with #carhacking. Feel free to check it out! https://hackcar.uk/Beginners-Guide-To-Car-Hacking/ … #carhackvillageuk

1123339319106625536.text:
I think we should replace http:// and https:// with just web://

The browser should try TLS before it tries plain, and notifies accordingly. Users should not have to give a shit about writing the protocol for a simple web page.

1033302727500161024.text:
Advice for conf speakers:

When someone you care for is speaking, sit in the first row. Be there for them. Laugh at their jokes, _actually_ watch the talk (Twitter can wait), make yourself visible for them.

Be the audience you'd like to have, and next time you will have it.

1031624722302132225.text:

1028343736198160392.text: Getting through Caesar's is like navigating whitewater. You have to read the eddies and back currents to move efficiently through the water^^walkers, all the while watching for falls and stalls.

1026968766393999361.text: So the DEF CON WiFi is actually the most secure public Wifi you've ever used. Get the certificate from https://wifireg.defcon.org/ . It authenticates the access-point to you (no "evil twin" attacks), and secures the connection for you authenticating with the AP.

1021893517931687938.text:
I’ve had some toxic jobs. Lesson learned:

When things go bad, good people leave, eventually followed by people who thought they could change things but got buried because too many good people left. Those left are bad people or hostages. 

The good people are your canary.

1125826160275931142.text:
Them: Our software is secure 

Us: Here is RCE and a load of bugs it’s worse than useless. 

Them: We’ve fixed all the bugs and hired a Pen Testing Team to review

Hackers: We found all the bugs 

Them: We fixed all the bugs 

Us: Here is another trival Priv Esc

FML

1125414212484911105.text: I can confirm that Windows XP on the Switch is both possible, and a complete waste of time...pic.twitter.com/RCWdU7iv8d

1118268140348166150.text: FML. Working solution. Unplug cables, re-plug cables. <Fire>. Check wiring diagram and plug in second device. <Smoke>. Check everything for an hour and then realise you’ve read the wiring diagram upside down. Swear a lot. Result, two dead Pis and a burnt thumb. FML.

1116843940957782017.text: Pro tip. When fuzzing hardware have a way to stop your fuzzer ‘when’ something happens. Also, run the fuzzer in very small batches. I’ve just had to sit through an hour of rerunning my log file and narrowing it down very slowly because I ran the thing for too long. #carhacking

1116099476882624512.text:
On the one hand I had a very successful evening #carhacking reverse engineering some of the CAN messages on my car test cluster. On the other hand the car now has 654,000 miles on it. 

Learning is a slow process though...

1115371576516665344.text: Aha! Tools fixed and through some fuzzing and manual testing I’ve managed to gain control over my fuel gauge. Productive evening #CarHacking for once

1115353315930406912.text: After an evening of messing about I’m now firmly convinced the reason my car hacking isn’t going well isn’t me, it’s the tools. Now to figure out what’s going on with the tools...

1111643314699337728.text:
Uh oh, I think my car needs a service ..

Cc @mintynet
#CarHackingpic.twitter.com/G7fISqZOFL

1102852828006100992.text: Finished reading my copy of @cstross Halting State for the umpteenth time again last night after a good 7 year gap. It’s amazing how accurate the book is to modern technology and where we’re going with it.

1101754706530045953.text: I’d add, anyone in IT should be curious. I didn’t start in security I ended up there by being curious.https://twitter.com/mackwage/status/1101571805385437185 …

1100158981941665793.text: Another unsuccessful night of #CarHacking. This time I got the hardware working, but nothing I tried generated a message that (when replayed) produced the same effect. I did manage to get the car to upset itself enough to require the battery being pulled though, so that was nice

1098875224462946305.text: I’ve bought one of these from Ian and they’re well worth it as an intro, it’ll allow you to get data off the bus and inject it backhttps://twitter.com/mintynet/status/1098671801180270594 …

1097580219874062338.text: Just your average Monday night, sat in an ASDA carpark trying to debug your tools to figure out why you’re getting no data. I swear hacking used to be more glamorous than this. #carhacking

1097132526311784451.text: Woot, that’s @BSidesLondon tickets acquired for another year. See you all there.

1095792638467420166.text: #1 rule of hacking, never do it on something you need because ‘sometimes’ things break even when you’re being careful. You’d think I’d have learned my lesson when I started lock picking but noooo....anyhoo, the car  is now fine and I totally didn’t give myself a heart attack.

1095767609495175169.text: ID successfully captured, isolated and replayed. Now if I hadn’t broken my set up I could try this in hardware...pic.twitter.com/XzvshGEjvZ

1095651186923970561.text: Jesus Christ. How did the automotive industry get away with these undocumented proprietary data messages for so long. #carhacking is a mess of guesswork trying to map things out.

1095409602559205382.text: Stage 2 complete, we have data to analyse... cc @mintynetpic.twitter.com/0fDEqFYkMa
